description: For anyone still relying upon virtual reality (VR) applications written for the OpenGL API rather than the Vulkan API that has been dominant among VR apps (and other modern games / software) for years, the Mesa code and in particular the Zink OpenGL-on-Vulkan driver now supports the OpenGL VR (OVR) extensions...
title: Mesa's Zink Driver Now Supports OpenGL VR Extensions

description: An interesting merge request opened this week and already merged for Mesa 24.3 comes from an Autodesk engineer adding Vulkan Windowing System Integration (WSI) around Apple's Metal API for use on macOS...
title: Autodesk Contributes Mesa Vulkan WSI Support For Apple's Metal

description: The FFmpeg multimedia library continues to enhance its support around the Vulkan Video APIs with the latest commits seeing H.264 and H.265/HEVC Vulkan encode support merged...
title: H.264/H.265 Vulkan Encoder Support Merged Into FFmpeg

description: GNOME 47 is out today as the latest major update to this popular open-source desktop environment...
title: GNOME 47 Released With Accent Colors, Improved Apps & More

description: The big set of power management updates for Linux 6.12 have landed...
title: Many Intel & AMD Power Management Improvements For Linux 6.12

description: Intel Compute Runtime 24.35.30872.22 released today as the newest tagged version of this open-source GPU compute stack providing oneAPI Level Zero and OpenCL support for Linux and Windows systems...
title: Intel Compute Runtime Offers "Preview" Support For Lunar Lake

description: Merged as part of the Linux Security Modules (LSM) updates for the Linux 6.12 kernel is the new Integrity Policy Enforcement (IPE) module that has been years in the making. Integrity Policy Enforcement is an alternative to access controls...
title: Linux 6.12 Landing Integrity Policy Enforcement "IPE" Module

description: The Btrfs file-system continues marching ahead with the Linux 6.12 kernel...
title: Btrfs Sees Minor Performance Optimizations With Linux 6.12
